sen.j: 仁実（にんじつ、寛治5年（1091年）- 天承元年6月8日 (旧暦)（1131年7月4日））は、平安時代後期の天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Ninjitsu (1091-July 11, 1131) was a monk of the Tendai sect in the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: 「天承元年6月8日 (旧暦)」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦1131年7月11日」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: Ninjitsu (1091-July 11, 1131) was a priest of the Tendai sect in the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: changed "monk" to "priest" for consistency with other articles
sen.e: Ninjitsu (1091-July 11, 1131) was a priest of the Tendai sect in the late Heian period.

sen.j: 藤原公実の次男。母は藤原光子（藤原隆方女）。待賢門院藤原璋子の異母兄。
sen.e: He was the second son of FUJIWARA no Kinzane.
As the second son of FUJIWARA no Kanzane, his mother was FUJIWARA no Koshi (a daughter of FUJIWARA no Takakata) and he was a half brother to Taikenmonin FUJIWARA no Shoshi.
sen.cmt: All three of these sentences are extremely short, so I combined them into one.
sen.e: As the second son of FUJIWARA no Kinzane, his mother was FUJIWARA no Koshi (a daughter of FUJIWARA no Takakata) and he was an older paternal half-brother to Taikenmonin FUJIWARA no Shoshi.
sen.cmt: 藤原公実FUJIWARA no Kanzane をFUJIWARA no Kinzane に修正しました。異母兄older paternal half-brother に修正しました。

sen.j: 比叡山に上り、仁覚・仁源・慶朝・仁豪・相覚・宗観などに師事して天台教学を学んだ。
sen.e: He entered Hiei-zan Mountain and learned about the Tendai Sect studying under Ninkaku, Ningen, Keicho, Ningo, Shokaku, Sokan.
Ninjitsu entered the temple on Mt. Hiei-zan and learned about the Tendai Sect while studying under Ninkaku, Ningen, Keicho, Ningo, Shokaku and Sokan.
sen.cmt: Changed "He" to "Ninjitsu" since this is a new paragraph; fixed grammar and commas; added "temple" as "Hiei-zan Mountain" is not specific; changed "Hiei-zan Mountain" "Mt. Hiei"
sen.e: Ninjitsu entered the temple on Mt. Hiei and learned about the Tendai Sect while studying under Ninkaku, Ningen, Keicho, Ningo, Shokaku and Sokan.
sen.cmt: 比叡山 Mt. Hiei-zan を Mt. Hiei に修正しました。

sen.j: 鳥羽院・崇徳院の護持僧を務めた。
sen.e: He served Tobain and Sutokuin as Gojiso (a priest who prays to guard the emperor).
As a Gojiso (a priest who prays to guard the Emperor), he served Tobain and Sutokuin.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: As a Gojiso (a priest who prays to guard the Emperor), he served Tobain and Sutokuin.

sen.j: 1123年（保安 (元号)4年）33歳の若さで天台座主に就任したが、これは40歳未満の天台座主就任の初例とされる。
sen.e: In 1123, he assumed the post of Tendai-zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect) at the young age of 33, which was understood as the first case of the assumption of the post of Tendai-zasu at the age of younger than 40.
In 1123, assuming the post of Tendai-zasu (the head priest of the Tendai sect) at the youthful age of 33, Ninjitsu was the first case of anyone assuming the post younger than the age of 40.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In 1123, assuming the post of Tendai-zasu (the head priest of the Tendai sect) at the youthful age of 33, Ninjitsu was the first case of anyone assuming the post younger than the age of 40.

sen.j: 最勝寺・尊勝寺の灌頂大阿闍梨を務め、大治 (日本)5年（1131年）に座主を辞退。
sen.e: He filled the post of Kanjo Daiajari of Saisho-ji Temple and Sonsho-ji Temple and retired from Tendai-zasu in 1131.
Filling the post of Kanjo Daiajari of Saisho-ji Temple and Sonsho-ji Temple, Ninjitsu retired from his post as Tendai-zasu in 1131.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Filling the post of Kanjo Daiajari (a priest who has received the special anointment transmitting the teaching and rituals of esoteric Buddhism) of Saisho-ji Temple and Sonsho-ji Temple, Ninjitsu retired from his post as Tendai-zasu in 1131.
sen.cmt: Kanjo Daiajari に (a priest who has received the special anointment transmitting the teaching and rituals of esoteric Buddhism) を追記しました。

sen.j: 翌年の天承元年（1131年）証菩提院別当・法勝寺権別当となるが、同年6月8日に没した。
sen.e: In the following year 1131, he became Shobodai-in betto (the head priest of Shobodai-in Temple) and Hosho-ji Gon no betto (acting head priest of Hosho-ji Temple), but died July 11 of that year.
sen.cmt: 「天承元年6月8日」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦1131年7月11日」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: Later on, Ninjitsu became the Shobodai-in betto (the head priest of Shobodai-in Temple) and Hosho-ji Gon no betto (acting head priest of Hosho-ji Temple), but died on July 11th, 1131.
sen.cmt: Without translating the names of the eras in every case, the translation needs to be changed from the original to make sense in situations like these: "The following year"in the Daiji era is the "same year" in the Gregorian calendar. I fixed this by changing "The following year" to "Later on"
sen.e: Later on, Ninjitsu became the Shobodai-in betto (the head priest of Shobodai-in Temple) and Hosho-ji Gon no betto (acting head priest of Hosho-ji Temple), but died on July 11th, 1131.
